name: Thailand
summary: Thailand – where the smiles are as warm as the sunsets

all_steps.name: Bangkok
all_steps.description:
สวัสดี or sawasdee means hello in Thai! 🇹🇭

Here we are in Bangkok. Bangkok, officially known in Thai as Krung Thep Maha Nakhon, is the capital and most populous city in Thailand. Over 17.4 million people, or about 25% of the countries population, live in the Bangkok Metropolitan Region.

Fun fact: Bangkoks full ceremonial name is กรุงเทพมหานคร อมรรัตนโกสินทร์ มหินทรายุธยา มหาดิลกภพ นพรัตนราชธานีบูรีรมย์ อุดมราชนิเวศน์มหาสถาน อมรพิมานอวตารสถิต สักกะทัตติยวิษณุกรรมประสิทธิ์ which translates to City of angels, great city of immortals, magnificent city of the nine gems, seat of the king, city of royal palaces, home of gods incarnate, erected by Vishvakarman at Indra's behest. The name is listed in Guinness World Records as the world's longest place name, at 168 letters. There is a 1989 rock song that consist entirely of the city's full name, repeated throughout the song.

all_steps.name: Bangkok Thailand Ward and Temple
all_steps.description:
Today we attended church at the Bangkok English speaking ward. It was a huge ward! We were quite late due to traffic and issues with Grab. But Fran was able to share her testimony. We stayed for second hour.

The church was located in the same complex as the temple. Upstairs is the MTC. We chatted with some of the MTC missionaries after church. The group we were talking with were from Russia and were called to serve in Russia, Georgia, and Albania. There was also a group from India that will serve in India, and a group from China that will serve in Australia. They have their largest group of missionaries in the MTC yet, 19. It was really cool to hear about their experience.

all_steps.name: Lumpini Park
all_steps.description: On the recommendation from some friends that were in Bangkok just before us, we went to Lumpini Park to see the Asian Water Monitors (Varanus salvator). These giant lizards just roam around the park and in the lake oblivious that they are in the middle of the city. We used the free pedal boats and explored the lake enjoying spotting the monitors, birds, fish, and turtles.

all_steps.name: Snake Farm
all_steps.description: Looking for something else to do in the area, we found this Snake Farm, located at the Red Cross hospital. Here they do anti venom research and extractions. We saw so many cool snakes! We wish we came sooner so we could have held the snakes and seen the extractions.

all_steps.name: Bangkok
all_steps.description: Bangkok is big and busy. Traffic is insane. And the metro is not very expansive. The city is chaotic. And after spending time in clean and orderly Japan, it is an adjustment. But one thing is certain, the food is great! Three words; mango sticky rice. And Pad Thai. I’m excited to be back to really good inexpensive food and lots of yummy fruits!

all_steps.name: Train Time
all_steps.description: All aboard! Instead of flying to our next destination we opted for the slower, more scenic, less expensive, and environmentally friendly option of the sleeper train! We will see how much sleep we are able to get!

all_steps.name: Chumphon
all_steps.description: Morning train tour

all_steps.name: Chan Di
all_steps.description: Train views

all_steps.name: Trang
all_steps.description: After about 14.5 hours and about 850 Km we arrived in Trang! There we had a driver take us to our house in Koh Lanta.

all_steps.name: Ferry
all_steps.description: Ferry crossing to Koh Lanta island!

all_steps.name: Hill Villa, Sala Dan
all_steps.description:
We arrived to what we will call home for the rest of the month. It is a lovely 3 bedroom Vila with its own plunge pool. It is brand new, only one other family has stayed here before us. It is really nice! Of course we began our stay with a swim, I enjoyed watching the egrets and birds form the pool!

Then for dinner we meet up with three of the families that we were in Vietnam with. So fun to reconnect with friends!

all_steps.name: Khlong Dao Beach
all_steps.description: We spent the afternoon at Khlong Dao Beach. I think we will be coming here a lot!

all_steps.name: Ultimate Frisbee at Long Beach
all_steps.description: There are a ton of worldschooling families on the island. Every Friday they meet up to play ultimate frisbee. We had a great time, and the sunset at the end was amazing!

all_steps.name: Snorkeling at Koh Haa and Koh Rok
all_steps.display_name: Snorkeling at Koh Haa and Koh Rok
all_steps.description:
Today we joined three other family friends from of our Better Together (Vietnam) hub on a snorkeling trip. It is fun that we have been able to meet up together in a different country.

Our tour took us to four different snorkeling spots at Koh Haa and Koh Rok islands. The marine life was amazing! We saw so many cool fishes, invertebrates, and corals. Then for lunch we had a Thai buffet on a white sand beach where monitor lizards tried to eat our lunch!

An amazing day with great company! So glad we got to do this with our friends before everyone travels in different directions.

all_steps.name: SCUBA
all_steps.description: We have had our sites set on getting SCUBA certified once Fran turned 10 for about a year now. We heard that Koh Lanta, Thailand was one of the best places. So that is why we are here! We signed up for Open Water certification. For the first day of the course you learn skllls in the pool. Wow! It was harder and scarier than I imagined! The kids did phenomenal! They are part fish I think! Our instructor ran out of patients with us, so our one day of pool instruction became two. We will see how we do in the sea!?!

all_steps.name: Walking Street
all_steps.description:
Walking Street - a fun place to grab some food! I was excited to try Thai Pancakes. Fran found some Nutella crepes :)

Harvey opted to stay home and finish some school work. When we got back he was rocking out with his music blasting. He was celebrating that he had finished his science class for the semester and earned an A-!

all_steps.name: Koh Haa Open Water Dives
all_steps.description:
Today Harvey and I did our first two open water dives at Koh Haa - number 5 and number 4. (Fran and Robbie are pausing their training for now). 

I was really nervous at first, but we took it slow. With the slow ascents and descents you hardly realize how deep you have gone.

They say snorkeling is like watching TV, but diving you are in the TV. It was so amazing down there! The coral was vibrant and full of life. We saw lionfish, puffer fish, Moray eel, sea snakes, barracuda, and so much more! It was an amazing experience!

all_steps.name: Koh Bida Nok and Hin Bida
all_steps.display_name: Koh Bida Nok and Hin Bida
all_steps.description: Harvey and I finished up our Open Water diving certification with dives at Koh Bida Nok and Hin Bida. I am amazed at how much more relaxed and controled I was by the last dive. Diving is so amazing, it is like you are right there in an aquarium or Finding Nemo. The highlight of the dive was hanging with the leopard shark. But we also saw huge schools of fish, barracuda, tigertail seahorse, a ray, spotted boxfish, and lionfish.

all_steps.name: Mango Sticky Rice
all_steps.description: I can not get enough!! So delicious! And Auntie Joys is the best! 100 baht for a large, best $3 spent everytime!

all_steps.name: Bamboo Beach
all_steps.description: Today we ventured down to the south end of the island to Bamboo Beach. I think this may have been the most beautiful beach we have been too all of our trip. The sand, the rocks, the trees, and the torquiose water. I loved seeing the long-tailed macaques. We have never seen so many hermit crabs, big and small. The kids made them a little crab sand castle.

all_steps.name: Phu Phu View Restaurant
all_steps.description: We then got yummy Thai food at this restaurant with the most amazing views! 😍

all_steps.name: Old Town
all_steps.description: Old town is on the east of the Island and was once the islands main port for trade. Now it is filled with souvenir shops and restaurants. We did some small Christmas shopping and got mango crumble with coconut ice cream from Grandma’s House.

all_steps.name: Sala Dan
all_steps.description: Beautiful views from our house. My favorite is the egrets hanging in the pasture with the cows!

all_steps.name: SCUBA
all_steps.description:
Fran and Robbie continued with their SCUBA certification today. The water was really rough on the boat, but they saw some amazing things under water!

The peacock manta shrimp and the puffer fish were Fran’s favorites!

all_steps.name: Shark Point (Hin Bida)
all_steps.description:
Robbie and Fran finished their Open Water Diving certificates today. And Wow! They saw some amazing things!

Highlights are 6 black tipped reef sharks, 2 leopard sharks, cuddle fish, lion fish, pipefish, Moray eel, squid, barracuda, anenome, and banded sea krait (sea Snake).

all_steps.name: Ko Lanta
all_steps.description: When others where having fun SCUBA diving, we would run errands, hang at the beach, run, swim, or meet up with other worldschoolers to play football, arts, or games.

all_steps.name: Wan Massage
all_steps.description: If you haven't ever tried a Thai Massage, its amazing! They stretch and stand on you in ways that hurt so good. Only 350 baht ($10). We keep going back!!

all_steps.name: Fit on Lanta
all_steps.description:
Nothing like doing some cross fit followed by an ice bath!! The teen hiit class was amazing. The adult class was intense!

Sore! But getting stronger!

all_steps.name: Cooking with Mon
all_steps.description:
Today we had a super fun time learning how to cook delicious Thai food! We each made three dishes plus mango sticky rice.

Robbie made Pad See Ew, Penang Curry, and Stir Fry Sweet and Sour.
I made Stir Fry Holy Basil, Khao Soi, and Stir Fry Cashew.
Harvey made Pad Thai, Red Curry, and Laab.
Fran made Pad Kee Mao noodles, Massaman Curry, and Papaya Salad.

Our instructors were a blast! We had so much fun! Check out Cooking with Mon and Sweet Life Lanta for their YouTube videos. You can get the reciepes here: https://shorturl.at/stGKX

all_steps.name: Langsod Beach
all_steps.description: Today we crossed the bridge to Ko Lanta Noi. There we went to Langsod beach. We had this beach to ourselves! No people, no restaurants, no crowds. Just us, the wide beach, and the crabs!

all_steps.name: Shark Guardian
all_steps.description:
Tonight we joined some other Worldschoolers for a Shark Guardian presentation. 

Did you know that…
….That sharks have been around for 400 million years ago
…. There are over 500 shark species, and 45 species in Thailand waters
… 97% of all sharks are harmless to humans. More people die each year from toasters, falling coconuts, jelly fish, talking selfies, flying, than sharks.
… Sharks are an apex predator and help keep many ocean ecosystems in balance. Sharks = healthy oceans.
… sharks are being threatened by human activities including hunting for teeth and fins, and pollution.

We vowed to be shark guardians and help protect sharks!!

all_steps.name: Kid Fit
all_steps.description: Fran rocked her Kid Fit class! (followed by ice cream!) Then Harvey and I did the teen class (and I can’t move 🤣)

all_steps.name: It’s Beginning to look a lot like Christmas!
all_steps.display_name: It’s Beginning to look a lot like Christmas!
all_steps.description: Watching Home Alone in our pool

all_steps.name: Khlong Chak Waterfall
all_steps.description: We did a short hike to Khlong Chak Waterfall. It was fun to hike through the jungle. We saw lots of gorgeous butterflies, monkeys, and some other cool animals. We even saw elephants bathing at the sanctuary near by.

all_steps.name: Mu Ko Lanta National Park
all_steps.description: Mu Ko Lanta National Park อุทยานแห่งชาติหมู่เกาะลันตา has beautiful beaches with hermit crabs and a lighthouse. There was also a jungle trail, but we skipped that.

all_steps.name: Christmas Eve
all_steps.description: For Christmas Eve we joined some other families at a beach restaurant for diner. They had a fire show and then Santa came with presents for the kids 🧑‍🎄

all_steps.name: สุขสันต์วันคริสต์มาส
all_steps.display_name: สุขสันต์วันคริสต์มาส
all_steps.description:
สุขสันต์วันคริสต์มาส
Merry Christmas!

We had a lovely day together as a family!

all_steps.name: Christmas Dinner
all_steps.description: Christmas Dinner looked different than usual this year, but it was delicious!! And we had beautiful views on the beach. We joined some other worldschooling families. It was a nice night!

all_steps.name: Running on the Beach
all_steps.description: One thing we have enjoyed is going on family runs on the beach!

all_steps.name: Haircuts and a facial
all_steps.description:
Harvey got the best haircuts of is life. To make it even better it was also the cheapest (200 baht < $6), fastest (5 min max), and simplistic!

We then got facials and learned about Thai acne treatment.

all_steps.name: Sea Salt and Soul
all_steps.description:
Although we have spent a month on an island in the Adaman Sea, we have not eaten any sea food. Chicken dishes are just so much cheaper. So we splurged for a fish feast on the pier (still <$50 for 4 people including drinks).

Robbie got the mackerel, Harvey got the barracuda, and I got the snapper. Very delicious!!

all_steps.name: Beautiful Beach Snorkel
all_steps.description: This morning our friends invited us to snorkel with them at Beautiful Beach. While out, we did some clean up (fishing lines, lures, and hooks) and saved a bunch of crabs stuck in a fishing net.

all_steps.name: Movie night on the Beach
all_steps.description: Tonight we watched The Greatest Showman at the beach! It was a lovely evening!

all_steps.name: Family Fun Dive
all_steps.description: Today we went diving at Koh Haa with some friends (Johnny and Scarlett). We did three dives! It was fun to go together and it was so beautiful!!

all_steps.name: Drive on the Left in Thailand
all_steps.display_name: Drive on the Left in Thailand
all_steps.description:
It was really nice to have two mottos for getting around!

There were some quiet roads where we let the kids practice driving too!

all_steps.name: Happy New Year!
all_steps.description:
We were headed to the ferry to leave Koh Lanta and head to the airport when I got the text message that our flight was canceled. We were able to reschedule our ferry and the our house was vacant that night, so we went back home. We had a nice evening playing games and eating Pizza!

We have absolutely loved our time in Koh Lanta. We loved our quiet house and having the Greener’s as friends next door was phenomenal!

all_steps.name: Phi Phi
all_steps.description: Ferry to Phi Phi islands! We didn’t expect to transfer boats in the middle of the ocean!

all_steps.name: Phuket
all_steps.description: Ferry arrived in Phuket! Now on to the airport.

all_steps.name: Good Bye Thailand
all_steps.description: We loved our time in Thailand. Friendly people, beautiful beaches, amazing food, and many adventures!

all_steps.name: Melbourne
all_steps.description: After an 8.5 hour red eye flight we have arrived Down Under! It is the kids and I first time south of the equator .The flight wasn’t very full so we had empty seats by us which helped with the sleeping. We all slept better than we anticipated, but not great.
